↳ In-reply-to ¬ª I don't want to derail this Yarn, so please fork this when you see it üòÖ -- Speaking of FM Transmitters and what not, I actually have a new project I'd like to build with two requirements:

I‚Äôll fork this myself üòÖ ‚Äì So far I know of Western Digital My Passport Wireless Pro | Plex Support which will let me take a portable ‚ÄúPlex Server‚Äù on the move with me and copy a subset of our media (TV Shows, Movies, Music) on the portable drive which runs a Plex Server and builtin WIFI Hotspot.

Problem is, this is only good for connecting say iPad(s) or iPhone(s) to the hotspot and using the Plex App. I can see no way to then stream something to a portable 12DC powered TV that basically only has HDMI input (and some older shit)‚Ä¶

I need something to connect to a wifi hotspot, stream a plex stream and re-stream that to a HDMI input source ü§î

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª #stupidIdeasOfTheWeek

I don‚Äôt want to derail this Yarn, so please fork this when you see it üòÖ ‚Äì Speaking of FM Transmitters and what not, I actually have a new project I‚Äôd like to build with two requirements:

  • Some kind of small compute device that can be powered either via USB or 12V DC Socket
  • A built-in FM transmitter so I can stream a subset of our own music (we‚Äôd copy form our NAS initially).
  • A way to stream Plex into the HDMI input of a small portable TV screen (also powered by 12DC)
